text.text: VTech Home video game console Second 1981 Cartridge Joystick & membrane keypad

text.name: sys_description
text.text: The VTech CreatiVision is a second generation computer and video game console hybrid produced by VTech in 1981. Equipped with an 8-bit 2 MHz CPU, 1 KB of RAM and 16 KB of video memory, it displays a resolution Of 256x192 pixels with 16 colors and 32 sprites. It incorporates two membrane controllers which, when placed in a special compartment on top of the console, can be used as a computer keyboard, or as a joystick once detached. The Mark-2 model will be equipped with a module for playing ColecoVision games.
